basics.name: Krish Joshi
basics.label: Principal Engineer & Cloud Architect
basics.headline: Engineering systems that scale effortlessly
basics.tagline: Specializing in Cloud-Native Architectures, Identity/Authentication, and Distributed Systems.
basics.summary: Principal engineer with 14+ years of hands-on experience building digital products at scale, from early-stage startups to FTSE 100 enterprises. My career has evolved from full-stack .NET development through to frontend architecture and cloud platform leadership, with deep expertise across the entire software delivery lifecycle. I specialise in React, React Native, and AWS, and have architected systems serving millions of daily users at companies like Tesco, Chase UK, and Cisco. I have significant experience with identity and authentication systems, having implemented WebAuthn/Passkeys, OAuth2/OIDC flows, and MFA platforms at enterprise scale. Recently, I've been at the forefront of integrating AI-assisted development tools—including Claude and Amazon Bedrock—into engineering workflows, dramatically accelerating delivery while maintaining enterprise-grade quality and security standards.

philosophy.statement: I build hardened infrastructure that behaves like living tissue—auto-scaling, self-healing, and observable at every layer.

principles.title: Latency First

principles.description: IAM least-privilege, OAuth2/OIDC, and encrypted data planes as standard.

principles.description: Distributed tracing, metrics, and alerting from day one.

work.name: CaspianOne Open Banking
work.summary: Brought in to optimise a FAPI-compliant Open Banking platform expanding into the Canadian market — focusing on performance, observability, and regulatory compliance across distributed serverless services.
highlights: Reduced **AWS Lambda cold starts by 40%** through dependency optimization and provisioned concurrency strategies, cutting infrastructure costs significantly.
Implemented end-to-end **OpenTelemetry instrumentation** across 12 microservices, enabling distributed tracing and reducing mean-time-to-diagnosis by 60%.
Architected **FAPI 2.0 compliant** authentication flows, ensuring PSD2 and Canadian Open Banking regulatory adherence while improving OAuth/OIDC response times.
work.stack: TypeScript, AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, OpenTelemetry, Terraform, GitHub Actions

work.name: Climatise
work.summary: Founding engineer at a sustainability AI startup — designed and built the entire cloud infrastructure and backend services from zero, enabling businesses to track and reduce carbon emissions using machine learning.
highlights: Built **NestJS/TypeScript backend services** with REST APIs for carbon tracking, deployed on AWS Lambda with automated testing and CI/CD via GitHub Actions.
Architected a platform that **passed Amazon's Well-Architected Review** on first submission, leveraging SageMaker and Claude (Bedrock) for carbon emission analysis.
Owned full **Terraform IaC** across dev/staging/prod, managing Cognito (Auth), Aurora, Lambda, and DynamoDB with zero-downtime deployments.
Ran and maintained services in production including **database migrations**, CloudFormation updates, and vendor service integrations.
work.stack: NestJS, Node.js, TypeScript, REST APIs, AWS Lambda, Cognito, DynamoDB, Aurora, Terraform, GitHub Actions

work.name: Tesco

Built and operated **authentication microservices** on Kubernetes, including database migrations and production deployments.

Transformed release process from **weekly to daily deployments** through CI/CD pipeline optimization and feature flagging.
